column4: hi folks, wonder if someone can help.  when connecting an external USB drive i get "waiting for device to settle before scanning" under 10.04 LTS.  any ideas?
wait... should stop scanning w/in 30 secs
have you successfully mounted this drive on the computer before?
yes i've managed it in the past.  what has changed is i've gone from 10.10 to 10.04 LTS (clean install)
I'm assuming you've installed all updates
yes i have.  i fear something may have changed in the kernel used or a configuration file but i'll be damned if i can find what it is via google
thanks for trying to help.  looks like i'm going to have to restart laptop everytime i want to plug a usb drive in
might have to do w/ how you unmount
recall there being two selections in 10.04 one being "Eject" and the other being "Safely Remove"
either by device notifier (kde user), umount
ah, I'm talking about stock ubuntu w/ nautilus, "Safely Remove" seemed to remove the ability of that drive to show up in the file manager at all..... hope they fixed that
never failed to cause the g/f to swear when she hit the wrong one by mistake and had to reboot
this is before the desktop environment.  dmesg never shows the inserted device as having an in /dev/
if its true..... that kind of blows that one must reboot.... known issue fixed in 10.10?
might be specific to the drives you have

might be fixed in 10.10 but 10.10 broke so many other things i didn't get to find out.  and given i have 3 different brands of USB sticks, 4 different ext hard drives that all work if they're the first device plugged in i'm puzzled
